Should people be wary of sharing their photographs online? Why/Why not?
How has modern technology changed the way we take photographs?

games.question: What types of games and sports are popular in your country?
Do you think the types of games and sports that are popular today will change in the future?
Young children these days do not spend enough time playing outdoors. What could be the possible reasons for this trend?
How can we encourage young children to take part in sports and games more often?
What types of games can benefit children most?
It is often said that games should be both educative and entertaining? What's your opinion about it?

telephoning.question: How has the telephone changed the way we communicate with each other?
Do young and old people use telephones and mobile phones in the same way?
What are the differences between making a phone call and writing a letter to someone?
Which one is a better way of communication - meeting face-to-face or telephoning someone? Why?
Do you think mobile phones have more utilities than just to have conversations? How?
Has the telephone reduced the communication cost in modern days? How?

colour.question: How colours are important when people buy things?
Why do different people like different colours?
What colours are commonly used for the decoration of people's homes in your country?
Can colours have any influence on people and their mood? How?
It is often claimed that our choices of colours reveal a great deal about us. Do you agree? Why?/Why not?
How our choice of colours are influenced by the advertisements we see?

entertainment.question: Are there a lot of places in your country for young people to go out?
What kinds of live entertainment are popular in your country?
What places would you recommend a tourist go to, for entertainment, in your country?
What forms of online entertainment have become popular these days?
What are the dangers of spending too much time on online entertainment?
Is entertainment these days better than in the past because of technology?

accommodation.question: How easy is it to find a place to live in your country?
Do you think it's better to rent or to buy a place to live in? Why?
What are some of the pleasures involved in making a home for ourselves?
Do most people in your hometown live in a house or a flat/apartment? [Why?]
Compare houses that rural people live in with the flats/apartments that most city people live in.
What the government can do to help city dwellers find suitable places to live in?

festivals.question: How important are festivals in your country?
Do you think the way we celebrate different festivals is changing?
Do festivals bring people from different cultures together?
How some festivals are more important in our life than others?
Do you think we will have more festivals and occasions to celebrate in the future? Why?
Do national festivals help us practice patriotism? How?

dancing.question: Is dancing an integral part of a country's culture?
How dancing has changed during the last two or three decades?
How important is music in dancing? Why?
Should dancing be taught to elementary students as part of their leisure activity? Why?/Why not?
Which one is more important - traditional dancing or modern dancing? Why?
What are some qualities to become a good dancer in your opinion?

traffic where you live.question: Has the traffic in your area become more congested over the last couple of years? Why?/ Why not?
Do you think the authority has done enough to tackle the problem? Why? /Why not?
Has there been any improvement in the transport in your area in recent years?
Some countries impose higher taxes on car ownership and increase fuel price to tackle the traffic jam. How is the scenario in your country?
Was any change introduced in traffic laws in your country?
Was any change introduced in traffic laws in your country?

weekends.question: In your country, do men and women usually do the same kind of things on weekends?
Do you feel that weekends now are more important to you than when you were a child?
How the way people spend their weekends has changed than that of the last decade?
What do you think our weekends will be like  years later?
Should offices request employees work on the weekend?
Do you think people get enough time to relax on their weekends? Why?/Why not?

cold weather.question: Do you think cold weather changes people's behaviour? How?
Does cold weather bring seasonal flues and other diseases? How?
Many people prefer the winter season over the rainy or summer season. Why is it?
Does the cold weather affect the lifestyle of people in the area where you live? How?
Climate change is affecting the world severely. How can we prevent it?
Is the human primarily to blame for climate change? Why? Why not?

visitors.question: Should visitors follow the local rules and follow local tradition when they visit a foreign country? Why? / Why not?
Visitors often have to pay more money as an entrance fee to places of interest. Is this justified? Why?
Some nations are more hospitable to their guests than others. Why is that?
Do you think people should study and learn about the custom and tradition of a country before they visit there? Why?
How knowing the local language helps visitors to a foreign country?
How can people learn to respect cultural differences?

about yourself.question: Do you have any goal in life? What is it?
What do you think you will be doing after ten years from now?
What changes do you think you have witnessed in your country in the last ten years?
What is one important aspect of yourself that you believe everybody should have?
If you can change one thing about yourself, what that would be.
How do you define success? Do you consider yourself successful so far?

your hometown.question: Why do people have a very strong bond with their hometown?
What is the main reason for liking a hometown other than the fact you were born there?
Do people with the same hometown have similar thinking and preference? Why?/ Why not?
Many people do not live in their hometowns. Why?
What can people do to improve their hometown even if they do not live there?
What changes do you think your hometown went through in the last ten years?

shopping.question: Is shopping a popular activity in your country? Why? / Why not?
Online shopping is becoming popular especially among young people. Why is it so?
What are the main concerns when buying something online? Why?
What are the differences between shopping malls in the past and now in your country?
Why do you think some people purchase things that they do not need?
Do you think shopping habits are likely to change in the future?

keeping contact with people.question: How does modern technology help us keep in touch with people we care about?
Has social media strengthened our bond or made our relationship more shallow?
The communication has become cheaper than ever before. Has it improved the way we communicate with each other?
How do you think people will communicate and keep in touch with others after  years or so?
Regular communication fosters a relationship while the absence of communication diminishes it. To what extent do you agree?
How has the way you used to keep in touch with people in your teenage years changed?

songs and singing.question: What are some popular types of music in your country?
Do people in your country enjoy singing? Why? / Why not?
How can songs represent the culture and tradition of a nation?
How popular are musicians in your country?
Some people think that songs convey emotions more accurately than many other art forms. Do you agree?
Do schools in your country teach music to young children? Why? Why not?
